contextId.information: Here "sleep" is a euphemism for those who are dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
Here "fallen asleep" is a polite way to refer to having died. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: those who have fallen asleep in him

contextId.information: These are polite ways of saying alive or dead. AT: "whether we are alive or dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: whether we are awake or asleep
